lenders.name: Maxine
lenders.loan_because:
We're all in this together. 

Warren Buffett, the billionaire who has committed over 99 per cent of his wealth to charity, wrote: "I’ve worked in an economy that rewards someone who saves the lives of others on a battlefield with a medal, rewards a great teacher with thank-you notes from parents, but rewards those who can detect the mispricing of securities with sums reaching into the billions. In short, fate’s distribution of long straws is wildly capricious.”

lenders.name: Liz
lenders.loan_because: Everyone deserves the opportunity to succeed.
lenders.occupational_info: I work to help manufacturers become more energy efficient.

lenders.name: Jill

lenders.name: Tori

lenders.name: Carol

lenders.loan_because: My sister informed me about this organization and gave me a gift certificate for the initial organization.  I hope to get a feel for how this system works and continue with sponsoring entrepreneurs!
lenders.occupational_info: I work with students who attend a 2-year technical college, preparing for a variety of careers...everything from culinary arts to automotive technology to engineering technology.  Also, some students start at the 2-year college and earn their Associates Degree and then transfer on to a 4-year college.  My job is to counsel students in the areas of personal counseling, academic advisement, career decision making, and answering general questions about college life.

lenders.name: Marion
lenders.loan_because: This was a gift to me, and I find it to be such a worthy cause.  I can't wait to get involved in this process.
lenders.occupational_info: My husband and I both work for the US Postal Service.  Our jobs are to service the public.

lenders.name: Amber
lenders.loan_because: i feel very sorry for the people that have now money and can not feed them selves

lenders.name: Josh
lenders.loan_because: I believe that loaning directly to entrepreneurs is the most efficient way to allocate capital.  I have been very fortunate in my endeavors so far, and think that providing access to funds will help others similarly meet their goals
lenders.occupational_info: I have a couple main focuses.  One the one hand I provide Technical Project Management consulting services for software projects.  On the other, I am a co-founder of OnLatte Inc. (http://onlatte.com/blog), which specializes in printing images on foamy beverages such lattes, espressos, cappuccinos and even beer.

lenders.name: McKane
lenders.loan_because: I am an entrepreneur and I want to help others.
lenders.occupational_info: President and front-end programmer for an internet company. We run many sites and online stores, but our largest is Scrapbook.com (a cmmunity and store for scrapbookers).

lenders.name: Carol
lenders.loan_because: it's the practical thing to do, I know that 100% of the money goes to the person that really needs it.  And it's a random act of kindness.........
lenders.occupational_info: I teach people how to use computer programs in the health care industry.

lenders.name: GoodStripe
lenders.loan_because:
The best way to find yourself is to lose yourself in the service of others
– Mahatma Gandhi

lenders.name: Ryan
lenders.loan_because: everyone deserves a chance for a better life!
lenders.occupational_info: I'm in the fourth grade and am a Cub Scout.

lenders.name: Laura
lenders.loan_because:
Government aid and subsidies are vital to many impoverished communities; however, are not the long term solution. Having studies economics and psychology, I believe that economic incentives need to be put in place to allow individuals to take control of their own lives. 

These loans will empower individuals to pull themselves out of poverty. Once out of poverty, families can then focus on larger needs such as providing their children the basic skill set, through an education, that will hopefully end the vicious cycle.
lenders.occupational_info:
I work at Digitas, a global interactive agency, that provides consulting, technology, and marketing solutions to companies around the world. 
During my free time, I love to travel and observe how humans interact; what motivates them; what drives them...

lenders.name: Joshua
lenders.loan_because: I think that everyone deserves the chance to make themselves better.

lenders.name: Art
lenders.loan_because:
Small loans in many parts of the world just may provide for a large positive change in the borrower's  life circumstances. 
 In the world where I type from large loans or purchases make little if any real positive, long term impact or change. New Car! LCD Big Screen TV! Etc! Hey! They already had what was probably a functional and useful car and TV. Where I type from, despite the "Global
Financial Crisis" and despite the many individual and personal issues that have resulted from job losses. No one has have to spent a large part of their day collecting firewood or carrying potable water for miles. 
  Art Geverding - From Vernon Bc Canada

lenders.name: Wyckham Family
lenders.loan_because: We are blessed and want to share. In 2008, we began the tradition of family members giving Christmas gifts to Kiva in each others names.    instead of other presents.   Gifts that keep on giving!

lenders.name: A Hart for NHS
lenders.loan_because: it is the best way to teach my students that a small loan can change a life.
lenders.occupational_info: I have the best job in the world, teaching young people that their choices have an impact, and they can choose to make a positive difference on this planet.

lenders.name: Kiersten & Blake
lenders.loan_because: Every little bit helps.

lenders.name: Emily
lenders.loan_because: I want to help people across the world live better lives.

lenders.occupational_info: I am a retired nurse. I worked both in Physical nursing and in psychiatric nursing. I found that most mental distress came from not being able to have a decent home,or a job,or being able to provide for their families.

lenders.occupational_info: I teach English  to university students in the Middle East.  My children keep me busy and we have a lot of fun.

lenders.name: Grey Heart
lenders.loan_because: I am not all that different. I struggle myself... to live the life i want and still pay my bills, care properly for myself and my pups. I have been rock-bottom poor and yet in the U.S. that means "still pretty damn privileged." I admire the determination and fortitude of the entrepreneurs here on Kiva. I am thrilled to see a program enable my little donations to go so far.
lenders.occupational_info:
I do 2 things. I sell antiques (old stuff) particularly from the mid-century era of my Grandparents. I was very close to them and although they are gone now, it makes me happy to collect and share stuff from their time (1940s–1970s).
I am also an artist... a graphic designer by trade and a fine artist by education. I merge these two into making stationery, home decorations, clothing and other personal things.

lenders.name: Sharad
lenders.loan_because: I believe in Gandhiji's saying: "Whatever you do will be insignificant, but it is very important that you do it."
